title: Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch

content.title: Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch Instructions

items: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Bring your right ankle over your left knee, creating a figure four shape with your legs.
Use your hands to gently pull your left thigh towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your right hip.
Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release and switch sides.
Repeat the stretch on both sides 2-3 times.

Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch Benefits

items: Targets the rear deltoid muscles, which are often neglected in traditional shoulder exercises
Improves posture by strengthening the upper back muscles
Increases shoulder stability and mobility
Can be done with minimal equipment and in a variety of settings
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional dumbbell or cable exercises
Can be easily modified to increase or decrease resistance
